body_html: I can see what the issue is, but I think we are going to leave it as is. I try to consistently use the word "Op" to talk about the type of nodes/operations. So Node/Operation : Op as Object : Class. We renamed "Node" -> "Operation" in the C and C++ APIs to be consistent with the Python API, though I think "Node" is a bit less confusing for this very reason. Note that I am also trying only abbreviate "operation" using "oper", never "op".
body_text: I can see what the issue is, but I think we are going to leave it as is.  I try to consistently use the word "Op" to talk about the type of nodes/operations.  So Node/Operation : Op as Object : Class.  We renamed "Node" -> "Operation" in the C and C++ APIs to be consistent with the Python API, though I think "Node" is a bit less confusing for this very reason.  Note that I am also trying only abbreviate "operation"  using "oper", never "op".
body: I can see what the issue is, but I think we are going to leave it as is.  I try to consistently use the word "Op" to talk about the type of nodes/operations.  So Node/Operation : Op as Object : Class.  We renamed "Node" -> "Operation" in the C and C++ APIs to be consistent with the Python API, though I think "Node" is a bit less confusing for this very reason.  Note that I am also trying only abbreviate "operation"  using "oper", never "op".
